text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The response explicitly addresses the connection test under Section II, stating: \"Most tribunals require one of these: - Logical connection: The counterclaim arises from the same facts or legal relationship - Transactional nexus: Both claims stem from the same transaction or course of conduct - Defensive necessity: The counterclaim is essential to a complete defense (narrower)\". It further applies this to the scenario, noting the counterclaim has a \"strong nexus\" because it arises from the \"same farm construction/operation that forms the basis of the investor's claim,\" which satisfies the transactional nexus requirement.", "criterion_id": "cd01ecfc-f099-45f9-9f56-ede0fb8737cb"}
